newsitem.title: JORDAN: Jordan Kuwait leads Amman bourse down.
newsitem.headline: Jordan Kuwait leads Amman bourse down.

text.p: Shares on the Amman stock exchange fell at the start of weekly trade on Saturday despite continued demand for a handful of blue-chip stocks, brokers said.

A sharp decline in shares of Jordan Kuwait Bank helped nudge the official 60-share Amman Financial Market (AFM) index down 0.07 percent to 160.82 points in busy turnover of 1.3 million dinars ($1.8 milion).
Jordan Kuwait Bank stock fell by the five percent daily maximum to 3.97 dinars, wiping out all of Wednesday's gain.
Active trade in the bank shares, linked to a possible merger or takeover by Bank of Jordan, have pushed the share price up and down in recent weeks.
"Today's fall may be a tactical move by some shareholders to discourage others from selling their stock," said broker Ibrahim Odeh.
Blue-chip gainers included Arab Bank, which rose one dinar to 258 dinars in Saturday's busiest trade worth 531,000, though brokers said most of that was in a single bloc transaction of shares.
Other stocks in demand included Jordan Cement Factories and Jordan Phosphate Mines, which gained slightly on a mixture of foreign and local buying, Odeh said.
But the general trend was downwards, with 22 shares falling and only 10 rising and another 12 trading but closing unchanged.
The private Pearl Index of the 45 best-performing shares in terms of turnover and financial performance shed 0.40 percent to 81.45 points, 2.30 percent down from the start of the year.
